CatDescriptText: Asa C. "Pop" Harris, owner of the Harris Hotel and Grill, was the father of Earl Harris, a sergeant stationed at Fort Leonard Wood, Mo., in 1942.  Mr. Harris other arm embraces Helen "Tutty" or "Tuddy" Miller, a waitress at the restaurant.  The man standing on the left has been identified as Earl Blessitt.  Blessitt and his wife Irene lived at 2625 Webster Avenue in the Hill.  In the background wearing a hat and coat is Josh Gibson (1911-1947), Negro League baseball star who played for both the Homestead Grays (1932, 1937-1947) and the Pittsburgh Crawfords (1933-1937).
TitMainTitle: Earl Blessit standing on left, Asa C. "Pop" Harris with his arms around waitress Helen "Tutty" or "Tuddy" Miller and son Sgt. Earl Harris, baseball player Josh Gibson standing on right, and two unknown seated men, at Harris Hotel and Grill, 2341 Wylie Avenue, Hill District
